p: As part of the selection process, a situational assessment was conducted which reviewed the local need to address climate change, through examining historical climate data, potential health impacts related to climate change, and current gaps within knowledge of climate-health risks. This situational assessment illustrated the expanding need to support the health of Simcoe Muskoka residents in the face of climate change. As such, in 2014, the SMDHU, with support of its Board of Health, identified climate change as the priority public health issue for the health unit.
